Job Title: Marketing Manager, Product & New Business

Location: Bristol, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Sales

Description:
Work Mode: Hybrid

Location: Hybrid at Bristol, PA

 Opportunity 

The Robern Marketing Manager - Product & New Business is responsible for management of Robern new business products and services from creation of the new products & services, through their removal from the product line, in addition to strategic product partnerships:

 Develop strategic plans and programs that drive luxury product innovation and overall business growth - identify and satisfy market potential, obtain the desired profit through strategy development, execution, and sales growth  Oversee product road map, forecasting, and commercialization  Partner with design, engineering, supply chain, channel marketing, sales, finance, and customer service  Contribute to customer satisfaction 


Seeking candidates who thrive in a start-up environment and are looking for limitless career opportunities!

Other competencies associated with primary function and scope of the role include:

 Thinking holistically about Robern’s business to drive growth & results  Establish partnerships that drive enhance luxury assortment/brand expansion  Work closely with the heads of Brand and Channel Marketing to develop launch plans  Work closely with engineering, industrial design, and operations to establish product & overall competency roadmaps  Serve as a marketing leader for Robern to develop, carry out and communicate management’s strategies and goals throughout the business 


Specific Responsibilities

 Co-Lead the development and prioritization of the 5-year New Product Development strategy to ensure long-term luxury standing, differentiation & profitable sales growth  Determine global market potential by product and channel through research, analysis, customer feedback and product performance.  Manage the development of sales forecasts, market penetration, and recommend sales policies, budget estimates, and projected return on investments for all products.  Direct the creation of strategies and tactics to enter and win in unserved and underserved product categories to drive Robern to its strategic share goals.  Partner with Kallista and Ann Sacks on luxury product development solutions.  Identify and proactively act on opportunities to improve processes within the marketing organization and business.  Manage product prices, terms of sale and discounts, recognizing our objectives and our competition.Approve the manufacture and establish prices for modified products.  Develop a personal expertise on product categories and markets including a complete intelligence file on competitors’ products, pricing, field activity, and channels of market distribution and end- user preferences.  Become familiar with product materials, manufacturing, packaging, and promotions.  Assist in preparing and coordinating special promotional programs to introduce new products to Sales and customers on a timely basis prior to their worldwide introduction.  Manage product manager to create comprehensive business strategies, sound project scope definitions and marketing analysis in all phases of product development.  Instrumental in working on the financial plan and strategic plan.  Identify cost reduction opportunities to increase product margins.  Analyze performance of each product in terms of profitability, volume contribution to product line and its potential, and recommend, where applicable, product line extensions and discontinuations or more emphasis through marketing programs.  Assure the new product vitality for Robern overall remains at objective through proper use of obsolescence and life cycle management. 


Skills/Requirements

 Requires a Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or related field; MBA in Management/Marketing preferred.  Minimum 15 years’ marketing experience with progressively more responsibility and a track record of results.  Approximately 20% travel is required.  The successful candidate for this role will have 3+ years of experience in an executive administrator or similar role.  An Associates’ degree is preferred, with a focus in Business Administration or related discipline. Individual must be self-motivated and capable of working independently, with strong abilities to multi-task and prioritize.  Must have strong communication skills, including proven skills in designing presentations.  This role requires high proficiency with Microsoft Office, including Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.  The successful candidate for this role will be assertive, highly motivated, and enjoys having a high volume of workload with wide variety.  The right person for this position will be discreet, polished, and place a high value on positive customer service interactions. 


 Applicants must be authorized to work in the US without requiring sponsorship now or in the future. 

The salary range for this position is $138,350 - $177,900. The specific salary offered to a candidate may be influenced by a variety of factors including the candidate’s experience, their education, and the work location. Available benefits include medical, dental, vision & 401k.

 Why Work at Kohler Co.? 

Kohler Co.'s mission is to contribute to a higher level of gracious living for those who are touched by our products and services. We understand that it takes investment in our associates’ development to make that happen.So, we offer ongoing investment in each individual’s personal development and the opportunity to collaborate with others across functions and roles at Kohler.

In addition to the investment in your development, Kohler offers a benefits package including a competitive salary, health, vision, dental, 401(k) with company matching, and more!

Important update for candidates applying to roles within Kohler Energy, including Power Systems, Engines, Home Energy, Kohler Uninterruptible Power, Clarke Energy, Curtis Instruments, and Heila Technologies. On November 6, Kohler Co. announced the strategic decision to establish Kohler Energy as a separate, independent business with Platinum Equity as the majority investment partner. Kohler will continue to stay invested in the Energy business following the closing and remains committed to supporting the acceleration of long-term growth strategies for both organizations. Talent and operational transition plans are underway, and Kohler Co. and Platinum Equity expect the agreement to close in the first half of 2024.Thank you for your interest in joining our growing team as we embark on the next phase of growth!


About Us

Beyond the competitive benefits and compensation, Kohler proudly offers a rich history, steeped in creativity and a commitment to our associates and communities.We invite you to learn more about our culture and company at www.kohlercompany.com .

It is Kohler’s policy to recruit, hire, and promote qualified personnel in all job classifications without regard to race, creed, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, disability or status as a protected veteran.If, as an individual with a disability, you need reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact kohlerjobs@kohler.com . Kohler Co. is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.

We invite you to learn more about equal employment opportunity by reviewing the Federal EEO is the Law and the EEO is the Law Supplement .

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
